Text: Evan Turner had a game-high 25 points and 11 rebounds, helping the Philadelphia 76ers knock off the Boston Celtics 106-100 in an early season Atlantic Division showdown. Jrue Holiday also added 21 points and 14 assists for the visitors, highlighting the Sixers' best offensive performance of the young season, as Philadelphia came into Friday night's contest averaging an NBA low 83.3 points per game.
